required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spirometric Response to Bronchial Thermoplasty in Patients With Severe Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: Spirometric Response to Bronchial Thermoplasty in Patients With Severe Asthma

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators plan is to retrospectively evaluate spirometry on patients with severe asthma who have undergone bronchial thermoplasty. The procedure will have been done according to the recommended protocol of three separate sessions. For each patient all available spirometric data obtained before and after thermoplasty will be used. Data will be collected from two centers, OU Medical Center and St. Francis Hospital in Tulsa, OK. All procedures done at St. Francis have been performed by a single physician and he is providing their spirometric data for the investigators study. The following data will be collected for all participants undergoing bronchial thermoplasty: Age, height, sex, weight, medical history, smoking history, baseline spirometry before and after bronchodilators, post thermoplasty spirometry before and after bronchodilators.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary endpoints are improvements in prebronchodilator FEV1 and FVC.
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoints are improvements in prebronchodilator FEV1 and FVC by 12% predicted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary endpoints are improvements in postbronchodilator FEV1 and FVC and degree of bronchodilator responsiveness.
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary endpoints are improvements in postbronchodilator FEV1 and FVC and degree of bronchodilator responsiveness by 12% predicted.

arm_group.description: Data will be collected from records of patients who, in the past, have undergone bronchial thermoplasty.

study_pop.textblock: Retrospective review of Asthma Patients' records

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >18 years of age
- severe asthma diagnosis
- decreased FEV1
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 18 years of age

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified data may only be shared upon review of OUHSC Legal office and IRB. Data sharing agreement required. Contact research@ouhsc.edu to initiate data requests. No personally identifiable data will be shared.
